byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Houston, and Ashley Southall from New York.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and ASHLEY SOUTHALL

abstract: Court records show Shannon Jaruay Miles, accused killer of Sheriff's Deputy Darren H Goforth, has significant criminal record, but no recent run-ins with police; Houston-area law enforcement officials assert Goforth was targeted for his uniform, and point to anti-police rhetoric as cause.
lead_paragraph: Shannon Jaruay Miles, the 30-year-old man the authorities have accused of fatally shooting a sheriff’s deputy, had a series of run-ins with the law from 2005 to 2009.

headline.main: Texas Suspect in the Killing of a Deputy Had Jail Time
headline.print_headline: Texas Suspect in the Killing of a Deputy Had Jail Time

snippet: Shannon Jaruay Miles, the 30-year-old man the authorities have accused of fatally shooting a sheriff’s deputy, had a series of run-ins with the law from 2005 to 2009.
